Position Title: 
Lead Senior Financial Analyst





Client Details:


Our client is a Global Publicly Traded Company that focuses on Manufacturing of Motorized Products and Vehicles. Our client has a fantastic +4.0 Glassdoor Employer rating with an amazing Culture and one Canada’s Best Employers for New Grads





﻿Role Summary:


Our client is looking for Lead Senior Financial Analyst with Main duties of assisting with analysis and preparation of reports in monthly closing, forecasting and annual budgeting for the Company





Key Job Responsibilities:






Prepare reports for use by the President and other Company Executive and Parent Headquarter Divisions as required.

Support monthly closing and analysis of variances to budget and forecast.

Prepare balance sheet for the annual budget and all rolling forecasts.

Assist business with achieving budget/forecast timelines and review of items loaded into SAP (via EPM).

Responsible for fixed asset closing on month ends, including comparison to CAPEX plan and reconciliation with WorthIt system.

Prepare bridge between US GAAP and IFRS for comparative financial reporting purposes.

Assist with J-sox walkthrough and testing as required.

Ad hoc projects as necessary





Location:

GREATER TORONTO AREA, Ontario  ** HYBRID WORKING MODEL **




Salary Range:

Based on experience





Requirements:



Qualified CPA designation (or in process)

Degree/Diploma: Business related degree (BBA, BCOM, or BA)

3 – 5 Years’ experience in Finance/Accounting related roles

Previous experience in distribution, or Manufacturing industry in sales and finance an asset.

Proficiency in report writing, finance and accounting principles, as well as proficiency with office software applications such as SAP and Microsoft Office are required.

A mindset for continuous improvement, and proactive to accomplish tasks

Aston Carter's government client wants to add a contract senior financial analyst to their FP&A team for a 3-month contract and could extend based on project needs and contractor performance. 





The core need of this contractor is to help their finance team within reporting, budgeting, forecasting and liaison with non-financial departments. 





WHY THIS CLIENT?



Crown corporation

Team environment

Limited to no OT

Great resume builder

Potential to extend or go permanent based on needs, performance, and fit to the team (90% of contractors has converted to perm)

Remote for now but moving into a hybrid work environment that is pending on team/company needs

Flexible scheduling






PRIMARY PURPOSE


This Analyst will be working within the FP&A team under the FP&A Manager. This group is responsible for the reporting side of the financials. 




Provides financial and business advice to assigned clients by reviewing and analyzing departmental and corporate historical and statistical cost and revenue information; assesses operational performance and assists clients in preparing their assigned operating and capital budgets. Develops various financial reports to support the business units achieve their enterprise objectives. 




KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES


Provides consolidated financial data and related resources for the development and reporting of the annual operating budget, capital program, Investment Plan and quarterly forecasts; identifies opportunities to enhance financial outlooks and other financial analysis tasks and projects.

Advises department/project managers on financial issues and assumptions that will impact budget and capital requirements; develops detailed budget instructions; provides guidance and direction to relevant staff members on operating and capital-related matters.

Identifies opportunities to enhance financial outlooks, other tasks and projects; forecasts and plans resources for complex projects or initiatives; prepares various monthly reports and executive dashboards to assist in insightful decision-making.

Develops multiple reports related to projects, programs, and other corporate financial reports to support the business units achieve their enterprise objectives.

Works closely with business units / Project Managers on their submitted financial information and other data, ensuring accuracy, completeness and compliance with corporate guidelines and determining reasons for the change from previous year’s budget; provides ongoing support to the units year's spending to their financial data requests and addresses any related matters.

Analyzes financial impacts of opportunities for improving efficiencies; creates financial models to analyze and track key business drivers and initiatives and prepares recommendations to relevant managers; reviews and analyzes financial and performance metric variances against historical trends, strategic plan, budget and forecast to develop business cases for process improvements.

Prepares executive briefing material; assists in preparing drafts for the annual operating budget, quarterly forecasts, and capital reports to the Board; participates in special projects, including providing financial analysis services to various project teams.

Analyses revenue trends, highlighting any red flags and recommending solutions as and when required.

Develops quarterly forecasts and the annual budget for corporate revenue, identifies revenue risks and formulates mitigation strategies.

Contributes to developing and implementing new revenue programs and in the ongoing management of the existing revenue sources. Recommends solutions to problems and involves in ensuring adequate closure of issues in implementation and execution of these programs






Skills & Qualifications:



CPA

5+ years post-degree with 2+ Years in an FP&A role (budgeting/forecasting) or Reporting Role in a large organization (100M$+)

Advance Excel (v-lookups, pivot and sum ifs) - send Advanced Excel from Aston Carter

Strong Communication & business writing skills (solid grammar/spelling - experience doing a write up; MD&A, Year-End Performance, Written Responses / Presenting information with Word, PowerPoint to executive level)

Exceptionally organized





Nice to Have; 


Revenue analysis

Large ERP system (SAP, Oracle, Longview etc.)

Public accounting standards

Prepares capital asset journal entries and reconciliation of capital schedules and reports and provides support to accounting services in the financial analysis of special projects and reports.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:



Processes month-end capitalization entries for all capital funds. Updates monthly schedules for: capital asset continuity, deferred capital contributions, long-term debt schedule, net assets invested, changes in deferred capital contributions and maintains the capital asset depreciation schedule for non- in Fixed Asset Module (FAM) assets.

Monitors compliance of restricted fund policies and procedures including internal controls. Processes month-end restricted fund transactions and entries; compiles monthly forecast data for restricted funds and analyzes significant variances. Prepares and maintains monthly restricted fund continuity schedule and reconciles fund balances to general ledger.

Collaborates with business unit holders of restricted funds and the BCIT Foundation to provide training, financial support and issues resolution. Monitors balances and identifies any issues including contract end dates, cross charges with operating budget, surplus/deficit positions and carry forward provisions.

Assists in preparation of reports as required by external funding agencies. Assists in the preparation of external financial reports including those required by the Ministry of Advanced Education, the Financial Information Act and Statistics Canada.

Leads the monthly and quarterly reconciliation process, providing training and guidance to staff when needed. Prepares long-term and short-term debt reports and other reports as assigned.

Assists in design, development and evaluation of special projects that impacts financial services and other business units. Assists in testing changes to financial databases including analysis of data integrity as needed.

Completion of professional Accounting designation (CPA) plus three years' of progressive experience in a similar role with emphasis on financial analysis, reporting, budgets, forecasting and capital fund accounting

Strong working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and standards

Excellent analytical & problem solving skills to be able to provide recommendations to management in order to make informed decisions

Strong self-motivated team player with initiative and professional judgment

Sound working knowledge of Enterprise Resources Planning (ERP) systems such as Banner with advanced level of Microsoft Office applications.

Being a part of BC's Top 100 Employers, and a member of the CCDI.

A generous Total Compensation package which includes extended health and dental benefits and a superb pension plan.

Eligibility for partial remote work upon Institute approval

Access to Professional Development Funds and opportunities for career development.

Enjoy discounted access to our fitness facilities (including classes like Yoga and Zumba).

Additional Wellness and Employee Assistance programs.

Position:
 Financial Analyst


Type: 
Full Time Permanent


Location: 
Vancouver, BC

 


Company Overview: 


WELL is an innovative technology-enabled healthcare company whose overarching objective is to positively impact health outcomes by leveraging technology to empower and support healthcare practitioners and their patients. WELL has built an innovative practitioner enablement platform that includes comprehensive end-to-end practice management tools inclusive of virtual care and digital patient engagement capabilities as well as Electronic Medical Records (EMR), Revenue Cycle Management (RCM), and data protection services. WELL uses this platform to power healthcare practitioners both inside and outside of WELL’s own omnichannel patient services offerings. WELL owns and operates Canada's largest network of outpatient medical clinics serving primary and specialized healthcare services and is the provider of a leading multi-national multi-disciplinary telehealth offering. WELL is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol "
WELL
". To learn more about the company, please visit: www.well.company.

 


Position Overview:


As a Financial Analyst, you will be working with the Accounting Manager and the Finance team, you are responsible for managing all aspects of financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and taxation. We are looking for an experienced financial analyst to undertake all aspects of financial management, including corporate accounting, regulatory and financial reporting, budget and forecasts preparation, financial risk management, as well as the development of internal control policies and procedures.

 


Key Responsibilities: 



Manage full-cycle accounting operations and support our business unit including Billing, A/R, A/P, GL, T&E, Cost Accounting, Revenue Recognition, and month-end

Manage the day-to-day treasury and banking operations

Coordinate and direct the preparation of the budget and financial forecasts and report variances

Prepare and publish timely monthly financial statements and internal management reports

Coordinate the preparation of financial reporting

Research technical accounting issues for compliance

Support month-end and year-end close process

Ensure quality control over financial transactions and financial reporting

Manage and comply with local, provincial, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings

Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls

Ensure financial activities are aligned with organizational strategic goals

Participate in business development activities and support the organization’s strategic goals

Liaise with external stakeholders including banks, auditors, financial advisors, etc.

Additional finance duties as required


 


 Requirements: 



Professional CPA accounting designation 5+ years experience in finance operations and full-cycle accounting functions

Thorough knowledge of IFRS

Experience in financial reporting for public companies (TSX or TSX Venture)

Experience in income tax accounting, income tax return preparation, treasury functions, financial planning, analysis, and budgeting

Strong ability to communicate clearly, experience in presenting to senior leadership levels

Excellent leadership skills with a strong desire to mentor and motivate staff

Prior experience working in healthcare and/or technology companies is an asset

Maintain competence in position by attending staff meetings.

Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, good command of the English language, and excellent communication skills.

Ability to work varying shifts and ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

Self-evaluate performance, establish personal objectives and participate in a yearly staff performance review.


 

WELL is committed to supporting a diverse, inclusive, and accessible workplace. We welcome and celebrate the diversity of applicants and team members across ability, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, and perspective. We strive to create an inclusive workplace where differences are celebrated and fuel our success – this is the WELL Way!

New Grad - Associate, Financial Analyst - Full-Time - EVENT ATTENDEES ONLY


Please only apply if you have attended our events. This is a pre-application for event attendees only. Our recruitment cycle begins in Fall of 2022. At that time, the role will be opened up for all applicants.




About Capital One Canada



We’ve been helping millions of Canadians for over 20 years by providing them with access to credit. We’re on a journey to put our customers first, and keep them there, by providing innovative, smart solutions that make banking effortless.


Working with us


Capital One Canada is a data-driven tech company that just happens to do credit cards. We focus on customer-first solutions, and we’re united with this common goal. Find your place at a truly great company that will nurture your career and help you grow. We have all the advantages of a startup, with the resources of a big company. In our dynamic, agile environment, you’ll be encouraged to have ownership over your own work, with ample opportunity for career movement and advancement.


An opportunity that’s second to none


Our office is designed to foster collaboration and innovation. A quick walk around this place will reveal a lot of whiteboards and enough Post-It Notes to be meaningful to 3M’s bottom line. We’re also passionate about our associates having fun here, which is why we have heavily used games rooms with foosball, ping pong, video games and more. And since it’s uncomfortable to do any of those things in a suit and tie, those aren’t required either. We have a business casual dress code because we believe our associates will do their best work when they’re feeling like themselves.



What You’ll Be Doing As a Financial Analyst



To give you an idea of what to expect as a new analyst intern, here are a few co-op project examples:


Developing an automated model to determine cost assumptions for business line present value models for investment decisions. This involved determining operating expense assumptions that focus on new account acquisition costs, as well as maintenance and servicing costs for existing accounts. The goal: Automating various input data sources and developing a standardized and repeatable model.

Building a new python-based model to automate HST liability forecast process. The goal: Create a simpler model that could capture more detailed expense categories and clearly identify expenses that are HST applicable vs not to justify retiring the old manual complex model.



You could also be potentially involved in regular finance or accounting processes, here are a few examples:



Finance



 Prepare financial forecasts in support of evolving product and strategy decisions. 

Develop reporting and analysis to provide insight into business trends.

 Analyze business metrics and performance



Accounting



Participate in the external financial reporting process, including the quarterly earnings release and monthly OSFI reporting.

Prepare accurate and timely reports, schedules and documentation to comply with IFRS and US GAAP reporting requirements.




Application Details




Please include your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcripts in one PDF in the attachment section under Resume/CV when you create your profile to apply

Once you submit your application, you will receive our Virtual Job Tryout Online Assessment to complete.

If you did not receive this, please ensure to check your spam folders and/or reach out to us at campusrecruiting@capitalone.com




Basic Qualifications




Currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree or higher from an accredited Canadian University




Preferred Qualifications




Previous summer internship/co-op experience

Superior analytical and problem-solving skills. If you know how to code in Python, SQL or other programming languages, that’s awesome. If not, don’t worry - we’ll teach you if it’s key to your role.

 Ability to communicate complex ideas both verbally and in writing




Perks Of Being a Co-op At Capital One




We will be moving to a flexible hybrid model in 2022

We'll send you a HP or Macbook when you start

Comprehensive onboarding with opportunities to network with the Summer intern class and stay connected through intern slack channel

Get paired up with a Buddy to help you navigate your way through Capital One

Participate in professional development opportunities such as lunch and learns and a Capital One Economics workshop

Participate in fun virtual activities such as our workplace yoga sessions, happy hours, coffee chats

Work at our office located in the heart of downtown Toronto, easily accessible by TTC and GO Transit located in the PATH

At the end of your term, we hold a Capital One Dragon's Den event where you can present your projects/ideas to Senior Leadership team

description:
As a Finance and Strategy Manager, your day-to-day job will be to help our business leaders make sound business and financial decisions. You will need to have a deep understanding of our customers and business drivers, allowing you to help steer Hopper’s growth and product strategy. To succeed in this role, you need to be able to understand the big picture, while also being unafraid to dive into the details and numbers. You also need to be willing to learn SQL.






Responsibilities:




Partner with our Fintech teams to develop and implement strategies to improve Hopper growth

Create, update and maintain financial models and forecasts

Prepare internal reports for business leaders supporting their decision making

Perform analyses of financial and operational drivers to craft our short and long term strategic plan

Challenge Hopper’s assumptions behind current product offering and pricing models

Work on Finance related optimization initiatives

Identify and help lead initiatives to improve forecasting, processes, and methodologies

Not be afraid to learn or improve your SQL / Big Query to be able to access, manage and gain insights directly from data







The Perfect Candidate Has:




A degree in Business, Strategy, Finance, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative discipline

3-6 years of experience in a top tier consulting firm, investment bank, tech or fintech company

Entrepreneurial spirit, ability to work autonomously

Technology industry experience is a plus

Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills, with strong modeling experience

Desire to learn SQL, expertise is a plus

Microsoft Office/Google Suite proficiency, and ideally Tableau 

Enthusiasm and curiosity for conducting research and answering hard questions with data





Despite the pandemic’s impact on the travel industry, Hopper has emerged stronger than ever. As the travel industry continues to rebound, Hopper has demonstrated significant outperformance with its category-leading mobile-only marketplace, delivering value to customers and supply partners with the company’s proprietary suite of fintech offerings.




Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company’s recent growth:


Hopper’s valuation is now over $ 5B The company’s valuation has more than tripled since early 2020.

The company grew its revenue by more than 300% YoY in 2021. Hopper’s monthly revenues are now 375% higher than its pre-pandemic high point and Hopper Cloud, Hopper’s new B2B initiative, is already 15% of its revenues and growing.

According to Apptopia, Hopper was the #1 most downloaded OTA in the US in 2021. The app has over 70 million downloads.

Hopper’s recovery is faster than the market and its share of the air travel market in North America is now 300% higher than prior to the pandemic, according to MIDT.

The company sells over $2B in travel and travel related financial services annually

Hopper’s fintech offerings, such as Price Freeze and Rebooking Guarantee, now represent over 70% of its air revenue.

Given the success of its travel fintech, Hopper recently launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud, where any travel provider can unlock a totally unique revenue stream by seamlessly integrating and offering Hopper’s travel content and fintech products. Hopper Cloud partners include Capital One, Kayak, Marriott, Amadeus, Trip.com , and MakeMyTrip.

The industry opportunity for Hopper Cloud is enormous as projections estimate that if all travel distribution channels offered travel fintech, it could increase the total consumer spend for the sector by $200 billion annually.





All this recent growth is just the beginning. There are still so many new opportunities we’re excited to tackle in the next year!

Job Description



Reporting to the Director, Finance Transformation, this position will be a key member of the WAM Finance Transformation team (WAMFiT) in supporting the transformation of the Global Finance function for Global Wealth and Asset Management (GWAM). The individual is a key member of the WAMFiT team, performing tasks and activities to support the delivery of reporting and self-service initiatives while building positive relationships across the WAM Finance organization and other Manulife partners. The individual will work alongside the WAMFiT Data & Infrastructure team, other WAMFiT workstreams, GWAM Chief Data Office, and WAM Finance stakeholders to implement the required business intelligence and reporting solutions to support the accessible pre-defined reports and ad-hoc analysis to satisfy WAM Finance reporting and analysis requirements.



Wealth & Asset Management (WAM) Overview



Our GWAM segment, branded as Manulife Investment Management (“MIM”), provides investment

advice and innovative solutions to retirement, retail, and institutional clients. Our leading capabilities in public and private markets are strengthened by an investment footprint that spans 17 countries and territories, including 10 markets and 120 years of on-the-ground experience in Asia. We complement these capabilities by providing access to a network of unaffiliated asset managers from around the world. GWAM-managed AUMA exceeded C$1.1 trillion as at December 31, 2021 and have experienced significant compound annual growth rates over the last ten years and over the planning horizon.



Finance Transformation



The Global Finance Transformation initiative is a multi-year, multi workstream transformation of Manulife’s Global Finance Organization – including People, Processes, Systems and Data. Since inception in 2013, this initiative has helped generate efficiencies for our global Finance organization. The WAM Finance in Transformation (“WAMFiT”) seeks to continue delivering on our Global Finance strategy and vision to realize and enable self-service, straight through processing, and automation to a target state and ultimately become a world-class global finance organization. This initiative includes the objective to standardize, simplify, and automate our financial infrastructure and processes for our businesses and achieve the finance vision and target operating model.



Key Accountabilities




Contribute to the successful completion of WAM Self-Serve Reporting (SSR) CoE Transformation Initiatives and related WAMFiT process improvements

Participate in and lead the various phases of reporting / development projects, including analysis, requirements definition, design & build, data conversion, testing and implementation with specific focus on data management and reporting & analysis

Liaise with Finance users and decision makers, systems owners and end users (through interviews and workshops) to define data and reporting requirements and design solutions that will meet their needs; facilitate implementation of new and/or improved reporting processes

Document business requirements relating to WAM Finance data, analytical and reporting processes

Work with Data Management teams to analyze WAM Finance data requirements and model the data design to deliver on business requirements

Analyze and understand WAM Finance reporting requirements and work with report development teams to translate into technical specifications

Ensure the quality of the data and reporting solutions by testing that the development results meet the business requirements; help identify and resolve issues/defects that arise

Query and review large data stores to understand finance and transactional information and business rules that govern the data, including data models

Act as a subject matter expert for WAM Finance reporting/analytical tools such as PowerBI, Qlikview and Tableau

Maintain and report challenges, risks, issues, decisions and action items including follow up with teams to ensure timely reply and/or action.

Consult with team members to understand issues, share experiences, brainstorm solutions and provide support.

Foster and maintain positive working relationships with GWAM and Global Finance teams across all geographies (Toronto, KW, Montreal, Boston, UK, Hong Kong and other Asia regions/countries), leveraging formal and informal forums to generate and explore SSR improvements and opportunities.

Other duties and special projects as assigned.




Key Qualifications




Minimum of 3 - 5 years in a finance, accounting or reporting/analytics role, ideally with experience on projects, enterprise reporting & dashboards and process improvement

Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Accounting or Mathematics

Analytical skills with the ability to design, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amount of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Strong knowledge of data reporting, aggregation and analysis techniques and query skills

Attention to detail and innovative thinker with the ability to influence and challenge the status quo to continuously improve processes

Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and build relationships with clients and stakeholders

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong problem-solving skills with demonstrated ability to work with financial issues and concepts

Motivated self-starter, with ability to multi-task and manage priorities effectively

A team player who is able to react positively to changing priorities

Experience in using Microsoft Office (Work, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Outlook, PowerBI, Teams) and SharePoint

Experience with business intelligence / visualization tools e.g. PowerBI, Qlikview and Tableau

Familiarity or knowledge of agile, project management processes, process improvement methodologies and tools would be a key asset

SQL Developer experience is a big plus

description:
Company Description



Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization


When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.

CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:


Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders

Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment

Accelerated exposure and responsibility

Global career development opportunities

Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles

A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance



If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.


Job Description


We are recruiting for an experienced Senior Analyst to join the External Fund Operations team within Investment Operations. This role is responsible for the coordination of all operational accounting, administrative, reporting and database maintenance processes for the External Portfolio Management (EPM) hedge funds and co-investments. The functions include, but are not limited to the support of existing Investment Operations’ processes and transaction management including the calculation of manager base and performance fee accruals, business line cash forecasting, accumulation of monthly NAV's, specialized trade processing and position level reporting for internal departments and management and other consulting/legal invoice payments and assist with daily/monthly compliance monitoring. In addition, the Senior Analyst will participate in business projects and new initiatives and the creation/support of appropriate procedures and controls. The ideal candidate will have a strong mix of operational, custody or fund accounting experience, along with solid technical and relationship management skills. They should also have an understanding of trade processing, settlement, custody, valuation and ideally experience working for or with institutional managers, fund administration service providers or investment custodian.

The ideal candidate for this exceptional career opportunity is a self-starter with excellent analytical skills, and prior experience in back office operations and investment accounting.


Role-Specific Accountabilities



Ongoing operational support of externally managed investments which include the review of the calculation and reporting of management base and incentive fee accruals, capital calls & redemptions, and invoice payments

Review and calculate monthly NAV's for external pooled funds and monitor estimate versus final and evaluate month over month market value and PnL changes

Review trade tickets and accounting entries for accuracy; ensure figures agree with transacted amounts, completeness of supporting documentation and appropriate authorizations are in place to facilitate investment closings

Update cash forecast for the business line and the proper reporting of all manager and fund related activity

Partner with colleagues from the Investment Departments, Treasury and Trade Support to successfully set up and fund transactions by proactively identifying and resolving operational issues

Assist in the review of financial statements, note disclosures and management reports to ensure accuracy and completeness, as well as providing valuable insights and commentary

Provide intuitive analysis of operational or business issues and provide direction in determining corrective action; promptly escalate irregular activities or issues

Maintain an ongoing effective working relationship with internal investment staff and external asset managers to ensure issues are discussed and resolved and financial controls and reporting requirements are met

Build a reputation as a subject matter expert in the hedge funds domain for issues related to investment operations and accounting

Continually strive for operational excellence; seek ways to streamline processes, create operational efficiencies and foster a culture of continuous improvement, enhanced controls and data integrity

Prioritize workload in a timely fashion to meet deadlines

Lead or assist in various projects and initiatives as CPP Investments works towards our CPP Investments 2025 vision




Qualifications



Relevant university degree such as Business, Economics, Finance, Commerce or other related discipline

Progressive experience and knowledge of financial markets and instruments, with ideally 5+ years’ experience in the financial services sector

Professional designations such as a CPA, CFA, CBV are considered an asset

Good understanding of various fund investment strategies, trade processing, settlement, custody, valuation and experience dealing with institutional managers and pooled funds

Hands on experience in administration, financial accounting in a financial or securities capacity

Experience with trade administration, settlements and position level reconciliations is an asset

Advanced Excel skills and comfortable learning new systems. Working knowledge of VBA and SQL is a plus

Experience with the SimCorp Dimensions Accounting system is an asset

Excellent analytical skills and the ability to think through problems, assess a variety of factors and recommend solutions

Strong interpersonal and organizational skills and a high degree of professionalism combined with the ability to readily adapt to rapidly changing investment business and technology environments

Team player who enjoys high performance culture

Comfortable and flexible with constantly evolving and changing priorities and are open to new challenges

Exemplifies our Guiding Principles of integrity, partnership & high performance.

Title:
                                 Financial Analyst

 


Location:                         
Toronto


 



Reporting to:                   
Director, Finance

 


Proactive and the Position Available





Proactive is a global, multimedia organisation providing breaking news, commentary and analysis on hundreds of listed companies and pre-IPO businesses across the globe, 24/7. And, uniquely, our renowned multi-media business is complemented by quality events management, smart investor relations delivery and highly respected research offering. 

 

We are one of the fastest growing financial media portals in the world, with offices and TV studios in four regions – Canada, UK, US, and Australia. Due to the growth of the organisation (organic and by acquisition) as well as our plans for a public listing on the TSX in the near future, we are looking to appoint a Financial Analyst. This is a new position that will be involved in acquisitions and supporting the finance department.  The ideal candidate will have direct experience of a rapidly-growing international organization, to join our high-performing and close-knit team.  





Principal Responsibilities





This is a hands-on finance role requiring a blend of attention to detail and knowledge of accounting and budgeting, with an ability to understand the bigger picture. The right candidate will be at ease doing modelling, budgeting and analyzing accounting and finance matters.  The incumbent will also assist in due diligence for acquisitions and assisting with post-acquisition integration





The Financial Analyst will have the following responsibilities:






Carrying out due diligence procedures for prospective acquisitions

Implementing process improvements and supporting information systems

Assisting integration of acquisitions

Assisting with the budget and rolling forecast, and other finance-related activities

Supporting other accounting and finance functions as required, including special projects, and management reports and external financial reporting.

Perform other related functions as may be reasonably requested






Attributes and skills, 






Professional – unquestionable integrity, credibility, and character.

Curious and with ability to understand all aspects of the business.

Analytical with a keen eye for detail

Responsive and customer oriented

Balanced and mature approach to decision making

Proactive.

Collaborative, team oriented.

Good communicator






Qualifications and Experience



Essential: 






B.Comm or equivalent

2+ years accounting/finance experience






Desirable:



Pursuing CFA or CPA designation

Experience in a small or medium-sized rapidly growing business

Experience with IFRS

Proficiency in Excel and Word 

Experience with Salesforce and/or Xero

Project management experience/qualifications.






Work Environment






Established 15 years ago in London, England, Proactive has grown its operations to become a team of 85 people serving a client base across all business lines of approximately 800 companies. With offices in Toronto, Vancouver, New York, London, Sydney, and Perth, we are truly multinational, and our employees work together across time zones on a daily basis.

We hire highly experienced professionals and work hard to retain colleagues by providing a comfortable and motivating work environment. Our turnover rate is low – you will have plenty of experience to draw on if you have a question, need help with finding a solution, or have an idea you think can improve the business.

We do not micromanage – we will hire you, provide necessary training, and then trust you to live up to your own high standards. You will work as an important part of a group where every member of the team wants to see you succeed. We are a big enough company to provide stability and comprehensive support for your role, but small enough that high performers stand out. Put another way, there is plenty of potential for advancement.

A competitive salary and attractive benefits package.

About Capital One Canada



We’ve been helping millions of Canadians for over 20 years by providing them with access to credit. We’re on a journey to put our customers first, and keep them there, by providing innovative, smart solutions that make banking effortless.

Capital One Canada is a data-driven tech company that just happens to do credit cards. We focus on customer-first solutions, and we’re united with this common goal. Find your place at a truly great company that will nurture your career and help you grow. We have all the advantages of a startup, with the resources of a big company. In our dynamic, agile environment, you’ll be encouraged to have ownership over your own work, with ample opportunity for career movement and advancement.


An opportunity that’s second to none


Our office is designed to foster collaboration and innovation. A quick walk around this place will reveal a lot of whiteboards and enough Post-It Notes to be meaningful to 3M’s bottom line. We’re also passionate about our associates having fun here, which is why we have heavily used games rooms with foosball, ping pong, video games and more. Developing an automated model to determine cost assumptions for business line present value models for investment decisions. Building a new python-based model to automate HST liability forecast process. The goal: Create a simpler model that could capture more detailed expense categories and clearly identify expenses that are HST applicable vs not to justify retiring the old manual complex model.



You could also be potentially involved in regular finance or accounting processes, here are a few examples:



Finance



 Prepare financial forecasts in support of evolving product and strategy decisions. 

Develop reporting and analysis to provide insight into business trends.

 Analyze business metrics and performance

description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 


Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The Financial Analyst, External Reporting is a key member of the team who is responsible for the quarterly and annual financial statements, reporting requirements of the Corporation. This role also supports the Finance leadership team in the completion of special projects including the implementation of the new accounting standards, internal process improvement initiatives, and technical accounting support.

This role has high exposure across the organization and given that the output is used for external reporting, the accuracy and timeliness of results and reports is critical.



What You’ll Do




 Prepare the quarterly and annual Financial Statements 

 Compilation of various financial metrics in the MD&A 

 Prepare quarter-end corporate journal entries and account reconciliations 

 Prepare technical accounting memos as requested by the management 

 Liaise with Legal, Tax, Investor Relations, FP&A and other Canadian Tire business units to collect and validate information for external reporting 

 Participate in cross functional projects to deliver process enhancements to improve the productivity of external reporting 

 Prepare quarterly calendars to set the timelines for the financial reporting process 

 Work with internal audit, CEO/CFO certification, and our external auditors to demonstrate execution of internal controls over financial reporting 

 Participate in ad hoc projects, analysis, new accounting standards implementation and preparation of reports for management 

 Support accounting teams across the organization to ensure they understand data, processes and tools used for external reporting; assist them in determining the best approach to addressing new information requirements 

 Utilize Hyperion and Workiva to optimize external reporting 




Who You Are



We are looking for individuals who are:


 Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment 

 Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business 

 Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business 

 Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward 


If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.



What You Bring




 Degree in Business, Finance or Accounting 

 Completion or near completion of CPA designation (CA, CGA or CMA) 

 1 to 2 years of relevant experience in industry or public accounting 

 Strong working knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) disclosure requirements and accounting fundamentals 

 Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite 

 Team spirit and commitment to continuous quality improvement 

 Working knowledge of Workiva, Hyperion Financial Management, and PeopleSoft is considered an asset 




About Canadian Tire Corporation



Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies .

Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Where will Amazon’s growth come from next year? In five years? Which product lines are staged to quintuple in size, and which ones are mature?



Who Are We



These are some of the most important questions at Amazon today. Canada Customer Fulfillment (CACF) will be the answer to many of those questions. Our Fulfillment Centers (FCs) utilize Amazon robotics, scanning machines, and computer systems that track millions of items in a day. As part of the team, you will utilize cutting edge data pipelines, build accurate predictive models, participate in new site launches, and deploy automated software solutions to provide forecasting insights to senior leadership (C suite) driving decisions effecting millions of customers globally.



Career Opportunities



CACF Finance is looking for a Financial Analyst to be the trusted finance partner at one of our sites. Experience with this team opens up several career opportunities across Amazon, e.g. senior roles supporting different business lanes, project management roles, and/or management opportunities locally, regionally, and globally.



Team Exposure



This role will partner closely with a broad range of Finance and business leaders in Operations, HR, Technology, and Retail; as well as with research scientists, technical product managers, and software developers. This role will design, develop, and maintain performance measurements and reporting on strategic input drivers to continuously improve the economics of the business.



Success In This Role



The successful candidate will have demonstrated an ability to influence business owners, support thoughtful decision-making, and adapt to a rapidly evolving environment. Regular collaboration with executives and various business units across Amazon will allow you the opportunity to exhibit your verbal and written communication skills. A typical day in this role, provides an opportunity to improve and create new measures for site productivity, innovate creative solutions utilizing large scale data mining tools, identifying high priority work/projects to maximize results for key stakeholders, and solve complex problems effecting companywide strategic decision-making.

Key job responsibilities


 Utilizing solid financial knowledge and business acumen to build financial models, interoperate data, draw conclusions, and make recommendations that deliver results, drive improvements, and influence leaders throughout Amazon which may have global impact.

 Responsible for delivering weekly/monthly financial close, planning, forecasting, budgeting, and consolidations utilizing financial systems and advance excel functions.

 Create effective business partnership, manage competing priorities, and providing guidance during unexpected events

 Intuitively utilize active listening skills to communicate data (both written and verbal) in a clear, concise, and unambiguous manner, adjusting your style based on audience, to articulate complex finance issues

 Collecting and analyzing quantitative data to develop relevant reports leading to cost reductions

 Take part in hiring, developing, and mentoring activities while you seek value, and leverage diverse perspectives

 Proactively identify opportunities to resolve finance defects and improve, scale, or simplify finance tools across teams and organizations.

 Contribute to work life harmony by becoming a positive, collaborative, and effective influencer to new team members as an indicator of operations excellence.





Basic Qualifications




 BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering and/or similar discipline with analytical bias

 3+ years experience in positions that require analysis and reporting financial results




Preferred Qualifications




 MBA and/or Professional certification (CPA/CMA/Qualified Accounting certificate)

 Experience working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (i.e. SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Essbase and/or Cognos), providing solutions based on results of ad hoc analyses to senior management for strategic decision-making

If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

C’est pourquoi nous offrons une solution de clavardage de nouvelle génération qui combine la puissance de l'intelligence artificielle et humaine pour offrir l'expérience client ultime en permettant des conversations hautement personnalisées. Notre chatbot d'intelligence artificielle conversationnelle agit à la fois comme un concierge de première ligne qui aide les clients à s'aider eux-mêmes, et comme un assistant virtuel astucieux qui aide à améliorer l'efficacité du service client.

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un gestionnaire des finances pour nous aider à développer notre activité d'IA conversationnelle en pleine expansion.

Vous serez un professionnel de la finance engagé qui supervisera le processus de clôture de fin de mois, les contrôles internes, les applications financières et les fonctions comptables quotidiennes, y compris la facturation des clients et les crédits d'impôt. Sous la responsabilité du directeur principal des finances mais vous devrez travailler en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe de direction de l'IA conversationnelle, vous aurez un rapport direct.

Ce rôle est basé à notre bureau de Montréal.



Ce Que Vous Ferez




Gérer un rapport direct, l'encadrement, le mentorat, le développement, la gestion de la performance et toutes les autres pratiques de gestion des personnes, y compris DE&I.

Coordonner un processus de rapports financiers efficace englobant toutes les exigences de rapports internes et externes y compris la préparation des états financiers mensuels en conformité avec les normes IFRS et US GAAP.

Gérer le processus d'audit trimestriel et annuel, y compris la préparation des annexes justificatives, la réponse aux requêtes et la fourniture d'échantillons, ainsi que toute autre demande ad hoc.

 Supervision des applications financières, notamment l'ERP Xero et le SAAS Optics, incluant mais non limitée à : la propriété du plan comptable, la rédaction de rapports personnalisés et l'identification et la mise en œuvre d'améliorations.

Travailler activement à l'établissement et à l'amélioration des processus formels de contrôles internes sur le reporting financier (IFCR) afin de garantir la conformité aux meilleures pratiques.

 Superviser la trésorerie, les opérations comptables, y compris la facturation, les comptes débiteurs et les comptes créditeurs.

Développer des stratégies fondées sur les données afin que l'entreprise puisse prendre des décisions bien informées.

 Superviser la RS&DE, le commerce électronique ‘’québécois CDAE " et d'autres processus de crédit d'impôt et de subvention.

 Assurer le suivi des exigences spécifiques du Québec, telles que la CNESST et Emploi-Québec.

Fournir un soutien ad hoc à la demande de l'équipe de direction et/ou du siège social.




Ce Dont Vous Aurez Besoin




Être parfaitement bilingue l'anglais et le français (tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit) 

Un titre de comptable agréé et un diplôme CPA.

Au moins 8 ans d'expérience en comptabilité, comprenant de préférence une expérience en tant qu'auditeur pour un cabinet d'expertise comptable ou une combinaison équivalente de formation et d'expérience.

Expérience antérieure de travail dans des startups et des entreprises à forte croissance, en particulier dans le secteur de la tech SaaS et de l'industrie.

Connaissance des processus de clôture, des opérations comptables, des contrôles internes et des processus de crédit d'impôt/subvention processus

Connaissance des impôts de la province de Québec et des spécificités de la CNESST.

Expérience de l'administration et de l'utilisation d'un logiciel de gestion intégré tel que Xero.

Connaissance approfondie des normes IFRS et/ou des normes comptables américaines.

Expérience de la gestion du personnel.

Engagement envers les résultats : obtenir constamment des résultats, en faisant preuve d'une performance élevée et en se mettant au défi, ainsi que les autres, d'obtenir des résultats.

Un haut niveau d’imputabilité autant pour soi que pour les autres membres de l’équipe.

Résolution de problèmes : utilise une approche organisée et logique pour trouver des solutions à des problèmes complexes. Regarde au-delà de l'évidence pour comprendre la cause profonde des problèmes.

Influence : Affirme ses propres idées et persuade les autres, en obtenant leur soutien et leur engagement et en mobilisant les gens pour qu'ils passent à l'action.

Leadership inclusif : Constitue des équipes inclusives et cohésives qui appliquent la diversité pour atteindre des objectifs communs.

Jouer pour gagner : Est capable d'obtenir des résultats par l'intermédiaire des autres, est doué pour établir une direction claire, aider les autres à réaliser leur meilleur travail.

Planification à long terme : Identifie les questions et les relations clés pertinentes pour atteindre un objectif ou une vision à long terme ; Construit un plan intégré pour la marche à suivre afin d'accomplir cette vision

Enablement : Met au défi et soutient les autres pour créer des résultats mais aussi développer de nouvelles capacités. Développe avec succès les capacités et les aptitudes de l'équipe et des individus qui la composent.




Qui Vous Êtes




Tenace. Vous êtes déterminé à réussir, et vous êtes motivé par la réussite des clients, des collègues et de la communauté.

Curieux. Vous êtes toujours en train d'apprendre et de chercher des moyens d'améliorer les choses.

Consciencieux. Vous tenez vos promesses, en prenant au sérieux vos engagements envers les autres, et… Vous faites preuve d'une forte intégrité.

Humble. Vous dirigez avec humilité et empathie, en respectant les perspectives des autres et en apprenant de celles-ci.






Role Description



We’re looking for a bilingual Manager, Finance to help us grow our rapidly expanding Conversational AI business . You’ll be a roll-up-your-sleeves financial professional who’ll oversee the month-end close process, internal controls, finance applications, and day-to-day accounting functions, including customer billing and tax credits. Reporting to the Senior Director, Finance with dotted-line accountability to the Conversational AI leadership team, you will have one direct report. This role is based out of our Montreal office.



What You’ll Do




Manage a direct report, coaching, mentoring, development, performance management and all other people-management practices, including DE&I 

Coordinate an effective and efficient financial reporting process encompassing all internal and external reporting requirements Including preparing monthly financial statements in compliance with IFRS and US GAAP 

Manage the quarterly and annual audit process including preparation of supporting schedules, responding to queries, and providing samples, and any other ad hoc requests 

 Oversight of finance applications including ERP Xero and SAAS Optics, including but not limited to: ownership of chart of accounts, custom report writing and identifying and implementation of improvements 

Actively work towards establishing and enhancing formal processes for internal controls over financial reporting (IFCR) to ensure compliance with best practices 

Oversee treasury and accounting operations including billing, accounts receivable and accounts payable 

Develop data-driven strategies so the company can make well-informed decisions 

Oversee SR&ED, Quebec e-business “CDAE” and other tax credit and grant processes 

Follow-up with Quebec-specific requirements such as CNESST and Emploi-Quebec 

Provide ad hoc support as requested by the leadership team and/or head office




What You’ll Need




Fully bilingual in speaking, reading and writing English and French

CPA Designation and a degree

At least 8 years of progressive accounting experience, preferably including experience as an auditor for a public accounting firm or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Previous experience working for start-ups and high-growth companies especially in the tech SaaS industry

Knowledge of close processes, accounting operations, internal controls, and tax credit/grant processes

Knowledge of Quebec province taxes and CNESST specificities

Experience administrating and using an ERP such as Xero

Proficient knowledge of IFRS and/or US GAAP

Experience managing people

Commitment to Results: consistently achieves results, demonstrating high performance, and challenging self and others to deliver results

Accountability: holds self and others accountable to meet commitments

Problem Solving: uses an organized and logical approach to find solutions to complex problems. Looks beyond the obvious to understand the root cause of problems 

Influence: Asserts own ideas and persuades others, gaining support and commitment and mobilizing people to take action

Inclusive Leadership: Builds inclusive, cohesive teams which apply diversity to achieve common goals 

Play to Win: Capably delivers results through others, is good at establishing clear direction, helping others achieve their best work 

Long Range Planning: Identifies key issues and relationships relevant to achieving a long-range goal or vision; Builds an integrated plan for course of action to accomplish this vision 

Enablement: Challenges and supports others to create results but also develop new capabilities. Successfully develops the capacity and capability of team and individuals on the team 




Who You Are




Tenacious. You are determined to succeed, and you are motivated by the success of customers, colleagues and the community. 

Curious. You are always learning and seeking ways to make things better. 

Conscientious. You keep your promises, taking your commitments to others seriously, and you have strong integrity. 

Humble. You lead with humility and empathy, respecting and learning from the perspectives of others.

description:
The Finance Manager will be the Canadian lead for the accounting department and ensure the timely and accurate analysis and reporting of financial information. As a strategic leader, they will be relied upon to collaborate with the leadership team for financial reporting, forecasting, strategy development, and compliance. This position will report to the Controller and be responsible for managing and leading the accounting team in Canada.


ELS is a subsidiary of Gorbel Inc, and is located in Waterloo, Ontario. 


 


As the Finance Manager, you will: 



Provide the necessary planning, organization, direction, coordination, control and management of accounting and finance for Canadian operations, including the general ledger, cost accounting, reporting, payroll, invoicing, payables, collection of accounts receivables, HST, US sales tax and monthly financial statements.

Establish, maintain, and monitor the financial records and transactions of the organization while assuring compliance with applicable provincial and federal taxes, regulations, rules, laws, and requirements.

Oversee the payroll process, and ensure any special payments (e.g. sales commissions) are paid in a timely manner.

Prepare, audit, and analyze financial statements including balance sheets, profit and loss statements, and other management reports as requested.

Develop the annual budget with guidance and input from the department, organization, and leadership team.

Complete the preparation of all information needed for the annual financial audit. 

Collaborate with the department leadership team to establish finance and accounting policies for Canadian operations.

Lead a team of 3 direct reports and conduct regular coaching and feedback meetings


 


Qualifications: Education and Experience



5+ years of progressive experience as a finance manager or accounting manager with demonstrated experience leading department staff.

Experience working in an accounting/finance position in a manufacturing environment, an asset

Demonstrated proficiency with ERP software and strong Excel abilities. 

Prior experience with payroll software (Easypay preferably) and accounting software, a strong asset. 

Proven knowledge of Canadian accounting practices, concepts, procedures, and financial principles.

Degree or Diploma in accounting, business, or related field preferred.

Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation, an asset.





 

ELS is a growing organization located minutes north of Waterloo in Elmira. We offer competitive pay; benefits within one month of employment; employer-matched RRSP contributions (after probationary period), and a teamwork-based work environment.

Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice .

We are currently seeking a new 
Financial Analyst
 to join our 
Finance team.
 This role is also available to candidates across Canada, excluding Quebec.


What your team does:


Our Financial Planning & Analysis team is focused on driving stakeholder and shareholder value by developing the operating and financial plans required to achieve our company goals. You will help our business grow, help our customers succeed, and continuously improve the way we operate.


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes numbers seriously, thrives in a rapid-growth, high-velocity environment, and someone who lives and breathes our values. As a Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting financial forecasting, analysis and contributing to reporting. This position reports to the Senior Financial Analyst, Revenue.


What you’ll work on:



 Gather data from various sources to prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasts, and provide key analytics, analyses, and summaries as required. 

 Develop and update financial models with actuals, conduct variance analysis, find and communicate insights, and forecast future performance. 

 Partner with Senior Leadership across the organization to assist with measuring and reporting on the performance of each department’s objectives, projects and initiatives. 

 Partner with the organization to provide analysis and decision support. 

 Monitor KPIs, identify trends and proactively work with operational leaders on opportunities to grow the business. 

 Ensure we have strong data cleanliness and source of truth reporting. 

 Work closely with Accounting to ensure all financial information is accurate. 




What you may have:



 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (finance, accounting, business); 

 Have 2+ years of Accounting or Financial Planning experience; 

 Be passionate about effective and intuitive data visualization; 

 Be deeply data-driven, analytical, and curious; 

 Be self-motivated, independent, and deadline-oriented; 

 Be passionate about building data-driven organizations and having an impact on the business. 

 Clear, concise, articulate, professional verbal and written reasoning and storytelling skills to communicate effectively to audiences at all levels of the organization. 




Our Team


We are an award-winning team that is both human and high performing –and are setting new standards for what it means to be a tech company. Clio has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies .

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion and believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation.

At Clio, we pride ourselves in enabling our teams to do the best work of their careers and are committed to providing the tools and infrastructure needed, wherever you choose to log in from.


About Clio


Learn more about our culture and benefits at clio.com/careers

At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round which came with a US$1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology and trust us, you want to be a part of this! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

 Senior Manager, Finance



DEPARTMENT:

 Finance, Guardian Capital Group Limited (“GCG”)

Vice President, Controller

Commerce Court West, 199 Bay Street, Toronto





Guardian requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 at least 14 days before the start date (subject only to any approved accommodation).







JOB STATEMENT:






Reporting to the Vice-President, Controller (the “Controller”), the Senior Manager, Finance, support the management of certain Wealth Management subsidiaries by managing all day-to-day responsibilities of financial reporting and planning activities within the financial department of Guardian.









ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:







Taking responsibility for all aspects of day-to-day accounting functions for the assigned companies, or business units, including managing staff;

Managing the month-end processes to ensure timely month-end closes including but not limited to: ensuring the accuracy of the accounts and results; preparing monthly analysis and commentary on financial results, and key performance indicators; and ensuring all reconciliations have been prepared and reviewed

Leading the annual planning process for the assigned companies or business units.

Managing the year-end audit for assigned entities and liaise with the external auditors;

Preparing and or reviewing and filing, HST/GST returns and regulatory reports;

Identifying opportunities to make improvements to current processes or procedures; and

Preparing ad-hoc reports for management, special projects and other duties as assigned.

Post-secondary education 

Chartered Professional Accountant designation preferred

5 to 8 years of relevant work experience with financial reporting, monthly analysis and planning & budgeting

Ability to meet deadlines, including the flexibility to work overtime as needed

Sound analytical skills backed with an attention to details and a motivation to the identify underlying issues

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Solid understanding of IFRS and the financial services industry

Ability to work autonomously or cooperatively as a team

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, good working knowledge of other MS Office applications and experience working with enterprise general ledger systems

Highly motivated self-starter with unquestioned integrity 

Commitment to continuous improvement










COMPENSATION
:





Commensurate with experience

description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
The Financial Analyst, External Reporting is a key member of the team who is responsible for the quarterly and annual financial statements, reporting requirements of the Corporation. This role also supports the Finance leadership team in the completion of special projects including the implementation of the new accounting standards, internal process improvement initiatives, and technical accounting support.
This role has high exposure across the organization and given that the output is used for external reporting, the accuracy and timeliness of results and reports is critical.
What you’ll do
- Prepare the quarterly and annual Financial Statements
- Compilation of various financial metrics in the MD&A
- Prepare quarter-end corporate journal entries and account reconciliations
- Prepare technical accounting memos as requested by the management
- Liaise with Legal, Tax, Investor Relations, FP&A and other Canadian Tire business units to collect and validate information for external reporting
- Participate in cross functional projects to deliver process enhancements to improve the productivity of external reporting
- Prepare quarterly calendars to set the timelines for the financial reporting process
- Work with internal audit, CEO/CFO certification, and our external auditors to demonstrate execution of internal controls over financial reporting
- Participate in ad hoc projects, analysis, new accounting standards implementation and preparation of reports for management
- Support accounting teams across the organization to ensure they understand data, processes and tools used for external reporting; assist them in determining the best approach to addressing new information requirements
- Utilize Hyperion and Workiva to optimize external reporting
Who you are
We are looking for individuals who are:
- Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
- Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
- Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
- Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.
What you bring
- Degree in Business, Finance or Accounting
- Completion or near completion of CPA designation (CA, CGA or CMA)
- 1 to 2 years of relevant experience in industry or public accounting
- Strong working knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) disclosure requirements and accounting fundamentals
- Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
- Team spirit and commitment to continuous quality improvement
- Working knowledge of Workiva, Hyperion Financial Management, and PeopleSoft is considered an asset
About Canadian Tire Corporation
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.
To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.

description:
Overview



We're looking for two temporary financial systems analysts to join our Financial Process and Solutions team. You'll utilize your accounting, business, and information technology expertise to support the daily operations of the division's financial systems.

In this role, you'll be responsible for a variety of functions relating to the systems and business needs of the Corporate Controllers department. We develop and ensure compliance with the organization's financial reporting policies, internal control policies, provide innovative methods to deliver health care solutions to injured workers, and manage payments to vendors and employees. We're also the providers of key internal and external financial reports.

One temporary position is approximately 12 months in duration and the second temporary position is approximately 24 months in duration.



What You'll Do




As financial systems analysts you will:



 Create new processes and solutions or maintain and improve the existing systems for the Corporate Controllers department and the Finance division, including developing or enhancing supplementary tools for automating and implementing small solutions 

 Identify, define, and create new business reports and maintain existing reporting inventory and tools 

 Participate in identifying the impact of upcoming changes on the current business software environment 

 Identify business process opportunities for clients, implement solutions, and make business and systems-based recommendations 



Is this a good fit for you?




We're Looking For People Who Can




 Understand and analyze the functions of a financial system and perform configuration and day-to-day troubleshooting of a financial system application

 Apply knowledge of general accounting principles and/or business processes to the areas of general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and/or purchasing 

 Write business or technical explanatory documentation or manuals 

 Take initiative in identifying and initiating tasks, following through and checking in after delivery 

 Approach work collaboratively, often working in small groups of 2-3 people 




Your Experience And Educational Background




 A degree in a related discipline such as computer systems technology, accounting, or an accounting designation

 Experience assisting client groups - collecting requirements or problem details, developing and delivering solutions or fixes, and checking back with clients for feedback 

 Sepcialist knowledge of Microsoft data and reporting tools (i.e. MS Access, MS Excel, PowerBI and SQL)

Financial Analyst
 to join our

 Gather data from various sources to prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasts, and provide key analytics, analyses, and summaries as required.

 Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (finance, accounting, business);

 Be self-motivated, independent, and deadline-oriented;

 Clear, concise, articulate, professional verbal and written reasoning and storytelling skills to communicate effectively to audiences at all levels of the organization. 




Our Team


We are an award-winning team that is both human and high performing –and are setting new standards for what it means to be a tech company. Clio has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies .

If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

 Excellent communication and organizational skills;
